intro: Indigofera brennanii, commonly known as African indigo, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and distinctive yellow flowers. The plant is notable for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, making it beneficial for soil enrichment. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Its seeds are used in traditional medicine and for dyeing textiles.
